snippet: Greek voters are charting the immediate course of their nation’s role in the euro zone, but the currency’s problems look to be longer-lasting.
abstract: Greek voters are charting the immediate course of their nation’s role in the euro zone, but the euro's problems look to be longer-lasting; currency has weakened steadily as Europe's economic crisis has worsened, recently trading near a two-year low at $1.26.
lead_paragraph: Greek voters are charting the immediate course of their nation’s role in the euro zone, but the currency’s problems look to be longer-lasting.

headline.seo: Euro May Have a Painful Path, Whatever Greece Decides
headline.main: Whatever Greek Voters Decide, the Euro Looks Likely to Suffer
headline.print_headline: The Day When Europe Holds Its Breath
